comment: Any finite or infinite sum in the nonnegative extended reals is convergent. This is a rather unique property of the set ` [ 0 , +oo ] ` ; a similar theorem is not true for ` RR* ` or ` RR ` or ` [ 0 , +oo ) ` . It is true for ` NN0 u. { +oo } ` , however, or more generally any additive submonoid of ` [ 0 , +oo ) ` with ` +oo ` adjoined. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2015.)
